SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface SupportBundleListener2

public interface SupportBundleListener2

An interface than can be implemented by any class that wishes to contribute to a support bundle. When a support bundle is requested, every registered listener will be called and given an opportunity to add information to the support bundle.

Since:
5.6.10

Method Summary
 java.util.List<java.io.File> collectFiles(SupportBundleLogger logger)
          If the collector needs to contribute files to the support bundle, then this method should be implemented to return a list of file handles for all files the are to be included within the support-bundle
 void collectText(java.io.OutputStream output, SupportBundleLogger logger)
          Triggers the data collection and writes it to the output stream.
 boolean enabled()
          Whether or not this collector is currently enabled.
 java.lang.String getCollectorName()
          Provides a human readable name for this collector.
 java.lang.String getSuggestedLocation()
          Returns the file name or directory name, optionally with relative path information, that indicates where this collector would like it's information stored.
 boolean providesFiles()
          Whether or not this collector contributes files.
 boolean providesText()
          Whether or not this collector provides text information.
 

Method Detail

collectFiles

java.util.List<java.io.File> collectFiles(SupportBundleLogger logger)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
If the collector needs to contribute files to the support bundle, then this method should be implemented to return a list of file handles for all files the are to be included within the support-bundle

Parameters:
logger - A simple logger than can be used to report information and errors to the support bundle log file.
Returns:
list of file handles to include within the support-bundle
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Any exceptions generated by the collector will be caught and logged by the support bundle framework.

collectText

void collectText(java.io.OutputStream output,
                 SupportBundleLogger logger)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Triggers the data collection and writes it to the output stream. This should be used when text information needs to be collected. All output will be sent to a single file.

Parameters:
output - The output stream to write to. You do not need to close this stream when the collector has completed.
logger - A simple logger than can be used to report information and errors to the support bundle log file.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Any exceptions generated by the collector will be caught and logged by the support bundle framework.

enabled

boolean enabled()
Whether or not this collector is currently enabled. Collectors that only work on a specific system or set of conditions can still be added to the bundle. They will only be executed if they indicate that they are enabled.

Returns:
true if the collector is enabled and ready to collect data, and false if it is not.

getCollectorName

java.lang.String getCollectorName()
Provides a human readable name for this collector. This does not have to be unique, but should provide enough information about the collector to allow a user to easily identify its output.

Returns:
a name for the collector.

getSuggestedLocation

java.lang.String getSuggestedLocation()
Returns the file name or directory name, optionally with relative path information, that indicates where this collector would like it's information stored. The path is relative to the top of the support bundles and should used File.separator between path elements.

Returns:
null for no suggested name, or a path name to use for this collector's data.

providesFiles

boolean providesFiles()
Whether or not this collector contributes files. If it does, then collectFiles(SupportBundleLogger) will be called.

Returns:
true if collector contributes files to the support bundle

providesText

boolean providesText()
Whether or not this collector provides text information. If it does, then collectText(OutputStream,SupportBundleLogger) will be called.

Returns:
true if collector provides text information.
